alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 23 at 2:50AM MST until December 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blowing and accumulating snow is expected. North winds gusting around 50 mph resulting in reduced visibility. * WHERE...Yuma, Kit Carson and Cheyenne Counties. * WHEN...From this evening through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slick road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds combined with wet snow could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is potential for a heavy snow band to develop across the watch counties with significantly higher snowfall totals and greater disruptions to holiday travel. The greatest potential for this snow band to develop is across western portions of Cheyenne county and across Kit Carson and Yuma counties; exact locations of this band is still in question. Strong north winds and falling snow may bring near blizzard to localized blizzard conditions. Blowing snow will continue throughout the afternoon where snow is able to accumulate.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
